lead_paragraph: By society's measure, he emerged black from the gene pool, a peculiar arithmetic that Ward Connerly insists he has never understood. ''One drop of blood does it,'' he said, reviewing the computation: 25 percent black plus 37.5 percent Irish plus 25 percent French plus 12.5 percent Choctaw equals 100 percent black. ''I suppose I could claim to be Irish, but who wants to stand there and argue the point every time? So I'm black.''
abstract: Special report Between Black and White profiles Wardell A Connerly; the 58-year-old millionaire businessman has become leading black opponent of racial preferences, first as a regent in the California university system and then as head of last year's statewide ballot measure banning state and local governments from using preferences in hiring, contracting and college admissions; photos (L)

headline.main: Questions of Race Run Deep for Foe of Preferences
headline.kicker: BETWEEN BLACK AND WHITE -- A Special Report
